intro: Teucrium jordanicum var. jordanicum, commonly known as Jordanian germander, is a perennial herb native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. This species is often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
